intro: Gonioscypha eucomoides, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers. The plant produces a bulbous underground stem, which serves as a storage organ for nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gonioscypha eucomoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
